image.altText: St Andrew's Cathedral School employee Lilie James smiling

items.synopsis: Lilie James worked as a water polo coach at St Andrew's Cathedral School before her body was found on campus in a bathroom in the gym area.

title.children: Man still missing and prestigious Sydney CBD school remains closed after 'horrific' death of young employee

image.altText: Soldiers milling about a tank

items.synopsis: The behind-the-scenes role Qatar is playing is a key factor in why the Israeli army has still not begun a ground invasion of Gaza, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Why isn't the Israeli army invading Gaza? One of the major reasons is Qatar

image.altText: People react as Palestinians search for casualties at the site of an Israeli strike on a residential building in Gaza

items.synopsis: The Hamas-run Gaza health ministry issues a 212-page document that it says contains the names and ID numbers of more than 7,000 Palestinians killed. Here are the latest Israel-Gaza updates.

title.children: Gaza health ministry issues document after Biden and Israel cast doubt on death toll

image.altText: An aerial view shows refugee accommodation on Nauru.

items.synopsis: New details have emerged about a group detained on Nauru, including reports of self-harm and a minor among the 11 arrivals

title.children: A 17-year-old is among a new group sent to Nauru under Operation Sovereign Borders

image.altText: A dark-haired woman in a denim jacket helps a child charge a white electric car.

items.synopsis: Recent research has found men are more than twice as likely to own an electric vehicle. It's a trend that's got experts concerned.

title.children: 'Women aren't interested': The assumptions creating a gender gap in electric car ownership

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit.

items.synopsis: The former Liberal staffer has lost a bid to keep his identity suppressed after being charged with two counts of rape in Toowoomba late last year.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann named as man accused of rape in Toowoomba

image.altText: Hallett Cove in Adelaide's southern suburbs as seen from the air.

items.synopsis: Residents in Adelaide's southern suburbs who have woken up to find their homes without water for a second morning, after the city's coldest October night in seven years, will be compensated with a deduction from their current bill.

title.children: Thousands of residents to be compensated after losing water supply for almost two days

image.altText: Three people with blurred faces leaving a suburban house.

items.synopsis: Samuel Joe Frost, 46, was arrested in March after a five-year manhunt by the Australian Federal Police and the International Criminal Police Organisation (Interpol).

title.children: Adelaide man pleads not guilty to 41 child abuse offences

image.altText: An old stone building with columns

items.synopsis: The boy's lawyer says his client was not radicalised, but prosecutors say his offending was "more than just sharing videos online" and he was coaching others about how to make bombs.

title.children: Teen apologises to court after pleading guilty to producing extremist material

image.altText: Two silver balls on top of each other in an empty pedestrian mall

items.synopsis: Three girls aged 12 and 13 will face court after they allegedly assaulted a convenience store worker and stole items from the shop in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Girls aged 12 and 13 arrested over alleged robbery and assault at convenience store

image.altText: Sam Kerr V Iran

items.synopsis: Sam Kerr and Ellie Carpenter score in Australia's win in Perth.

title.children: Matildas defeat Iran 2-0 in first Olympic qualifier

image.altText: NT Police car flashing lights

items.synopsis: A Tasmanian man avoids jail time after pleading guilty to non-fatal strangling and assaulting his former partner, in one of the state's first cases since new laws were brought in.

title.children: Man who attempted to strangle former partner and told her 'you deserve this' avoids prison

image.altText: The sun in a cloudy sky sets over a beach

items.synopsis: Extreme and severe weather warnings are gripping Australia this week all the way from the north-west to the south-east, ranging from fires, heatwaves, rain, a flood threat, a cold front, and a potential cyclone.

title.children: Extreme heatwave warnings grip Australia's north as the south-east prepares for a cold front

image.altText: a flattened burnt-out building photographed from a helicopter

items.synopsis: Authorities have confirmed at least 16 homes have been destroyed in Tara, with dry lightning storms also causing havoc in the region for firefighters overnight.

title.children: Sixteen homes lost in Tara as Queensland bushfire emergency continues

image.altText: A courtyard of a hospital showing burned out cars and fire damage.

items.synopsis: A week on it is still unclear who caused the blast at the al-Ahli Arab hospital in Gaza, but more Western leaders and governments have sought to blame a Palestinian rocket for the explosion which killed many civilians.

title.children: New assessments point to rocket failure in Gaza hospital blast, but questions remain

image.altText: Birds Eyre-view of land and water where the desalination plant will be built if approved.

items.synopsis: A former senator's bid to get more information about SA Water's decision to build a desalination plant at Billy Light's Point is knocked back, but Rex Patrick says he won't give up and locals deserve to know more about the decision.

title.children: SA Water knocks back FOI request into Eyre Peninsula desal plant decision

image.altText: Penny Wong, Richard Marles and Anthony Albanese at a press conference

items.synopsis: With the prime minister out of the country this week, clear differences emerged between the acting PM and the foreign minister, who diverged somewhat on the Israel-Hamas conflict, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: With Albanese in the US, Israel-Gaza conflict is shining a light on the differences between his deputies

image.altText: Police cars and other vehicles are seen parked and travelling along a street in Lewiston, Maine at night

items.synopsis: Police in the north-east US city of Lewiston say locals should shelter as they search for an active shooter.

title.children: Police hunt for mass shooter on the run in Maine

image.altText: A woman stares strongly into the camera in front of burnt out trees

items.synopsis: By any measure, the past 12 months have been tragic for Kerry Dare. But as plumes of dark grey and black smoke edge closer to her home in Wieambilla, her humour and resilience is remarkable.

title.children: Kerry lost her husband in a shooting that rocked the nation. Now bushfire is nearing her home — but she's still smiling

image.altText: A male police officer speaks to a young girl in the arms of another male police officer

items.synopsis: He was one of the high-profile police officers who rescued Cleo Smith from her kidnapper, but now Cameron Blaine is at the centre of a Corruption and Crime Commission probe.

title.children: 'Unwise' relationship saw Cleo Smith detective leak confidential information to journalist, CCC report finds

image.altText: A close up of an old gun.

items.synopsis: An antique gun collector near Brisbane believes he's acquired a gun used by Ned Kelly's infamous gang.

title.children: Antique collector believes he's acquired a gun used by Ned Kelly's gang

image.altText: David Beckahm stands in the rain

items.synopsis: Former Socceroos-turned-agent Andy Bernal was David Beckham's "right-hand man" when the star played for Real Madrid. It was a time of parties with Ronaldo, high-speed car chases, phone hacking, and a paparazzi that would stop at nothing to get a killer shot.

title.children: 'Madness and insanity': What it was like being David Beckham's right-hand man

image.altText: Tony Burke speaks at a press conference at Parliament House.

items.synopsis: The government department responsible for overseeing federal workplace and employment conditions had to pay $200,000 to rectify a more than $60,000 underpayment of 99 staff.

title.children: Staff underpaid at federal department responsible for employment

image.altText: Ms Mann smiles as she walks down a pier, the ocean in the background.

items.synopsis: A fresh investigation finds there were several failures in communication, staffing and the application of protocols before Monika Mann was discharged from Fiona Stanley Hospital in Perth, days after giving birth to twins.

title.children: Monika took her beautiful twins home from hospital. She was dead 12 hours later

image.altText: Jaeden Tito arrest

items.synopsis: Jaeden Tito was flown from NSW to Melbourne under police guard and driven straight to the Melbourne Magistrates Court after being charged over the September shooting.

title.children: Sydney man faces court over cafe killing of Melbourne gangland figure Gavin Preston

image.altText: An elderly woman in a church

items.synopsis: Clare Nowland, 95, died in hospital a week after she was tasered at an aged care home at Cooma in the state's south on May 17.

title.children: Family of Clare Nowland granted access to police body-worn footage of her tasering in aged care home

image.altText: Jodie Haydon, Anthony Albanese, Joe Biden and Jill Biden wave from the White House balcony.

items.synopsis: To say Anthony Albanese is walking a diplomatic tightrope as he mends fences with China, while drawing ever closer to the US, is putting it mildly, writes David Speers.

title.children: Just days before his China visit, Albanese is warmly welcomed to Washington — and there's no mistaking Biden's message

image.altText: A woman in black clothing on her balcony looking at a park, next to a pink stroller with a toy baby in it.

items.synopsis: Lenah arrived at a local park, expecting to meet with a child protection worker she thought would help find her family accommodation, but instead she found police and departmental officials lining the street.

title.children: 'Please, mum, we'll be good': When child protection took Lenah's children, they blamed themselves

image.altText: A young girl holding a poster saying 'Remembering Cassius".

items.synopsis: Prosecutors are considering laying a new charge against one of the four people accused of murdering Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey, the WA Supreme Court is told.

title.children: One of Cassius Turvey's accused murderers may face fresh charge amid 'new evidence', court hears

image.altText: Cans of beans, spaghetti, peaches and fruit salad made by SPC Ardmona.

items.synopsis: The food processor launches a capital raising venture available to Goulburn Valley residents only, to fund new products and help the company compete internationally.

title.children: Canned fruit and vegetable company SPC asks local community for $20 million cash injection

image.altText: Adam and Damian, the creators of Odd Studio, stand with a huge wolf costume in their studio.

items.synopsis: In a workshop in Marrickville, this Australian team has worked on creating the monsters and practical effects on films including Star Wars, Alien and Mad Max. Their latest challenge is a pregnant werewolf.

title.children: 'Pinch-myself moment': Meet the Aussies who made the Darth Vader suit and your favourite monsters
